critique: This executive order, issued in 1991, addresses the national emergency declared in response to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait. It primarily focuses on providing additional authority to the Department of Defense and the Department of Transportation, particularly regarding the activation of Ready Reserve units and the management of personnel within the armed forces. The order invokes sections of Title 10 of the United States Code to achieve these objectives. There is nothing about immigration, social inclusion, or economic regulation. The order delegates authority to the Secretary of Defense and other civilian subordinates. It does not create any new rights or benefits enforceable at law. It is effective immediately and will be transmitted to Congress and published in the Federal Register.
